STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 27, 2025
Thomas Hull
St. Clair County Juvenile Intervention Unit
1170 Michigan Rd,
Port Huron, MI, 48060-4658
RE: License#: CO741002625
Dear Mr. Hull:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on October 1, 2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during the licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
N/A - court operated program.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Financial Overview
Not applicable.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The administration is eager to open the program to youth. They report feeling
prepared for the youth and staff and hope to start admissions within a week or
two. There were no concerns noted at this time.
There were no youth placed in the program at the time of the onsite inspection;
therefore, no youth were interviewed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on October 1, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
__________________________________October 23, 2025__
Stephanie Meeuwenberg Date
